title: Argentina's new president is torn between demands of his people and international investors
text:
Even in the moment of victory, Argentina’s new president-elect Alberto Fernandez had a warning for his supporters: “The times ahead are not easy.”

That is something of an understatement. Argentinians decisively rejected the austerity of Mauricio Macri’s four-year presidency in favour of the centre-left Peronist, but Fernandez has no easy path ahead to help salvage the economy. Argentina has been in recession since 2018, inflation has jumped above 50pc due to the collapse of the peso and unemployment is above 10pc.

The International Monetary Fund last year granted the country its biggest ever loan - $57bn - but only $44bn has been drawn down so far. Argentina has a mountain of debt to pay back...
